vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
σανδάλ-ιον [ᾰ], τό,
diminutive of σάνδαλον, mostly in plural, sandals, [LXX+5th c.BC+]
__2 horseshoe, σ. ὀνικά [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II a surgical bandage, [Refs 1st c.AD+], as variant for σανδάλιος, ὁ, which is found also in Heraclas cited in [same work][Refs]
__III see at {σάνδαλον} [Refs]
vocabInfos.mediumDef: a sandal, a sole of wood or hide, covering the bottom of the foot, and bound on with leathern thongs, Mk. 6:9, Acts 12:8*
